greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime of the form LegendreP[2*n, k], k integer > 0.
comment: LegendreP [2*n, x] is the 2*n th Legendre polynomial of the first kind evaluated at x.
The corresponding values k are in A219313.
reference: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 798.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Legendre Polynomial
example: a(1) = 13 because LegendreP [2*1, x] = (3x^2 - 1)/2  and LegendreP[2,3] = 13 is prime, where 3 = A219313(1).
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(P=pollegendre(2*n),k,t); while(denominator(t=subst(P,'x,k++))>1 || !ispseudoprime(t),); t \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 18 2017
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Nov 17 2012
